title: Research
text:
My research focuses on understanding social stratification and inequality in contemporary Japanese society through quantitative analysis of survey data.



Social stratification and mobility: Examining patterns of intergenerational mobility and the mechanisms that reproduce social inequality
Educational inequality: Understanding how family background affects educational attainment and the role of schools in mediating inequality
Quantitative methodology: Developing and applying advanced statistical methods for social research
Social surveys: Design and analysis of large-scale social surveys

title: Research
text:
Peer-Reviewed Articles

English Journals

Fujihara, S. (2024). Identifying the Role of High School in Educational Inequality: A Causal Mediation Approach. Social Science Research, 124C, 103077. DOI: 10.1016/j.ssresearch.2024.103077 
Fujihara, S. & Ishida, H. (2024). College Is Not the Great Equalizer in Japan. Socius: Sociological Research for a Dynamic World, 10. DOI: 10.1177/23780231231225558 
Fujihara, S. (2023). Explaining Class Differences in Educational Attainment in Japan: An Empirical Test of the Breen and Goldthorpe Model. Research in Social Stratification and Mobility, 83, 100770. DOI: 10.1016/j.rssm.2023.100770 
Entrich, S. R. & Fujihara, S. (2022). New Horizontal Inequalities in Japanese Education? Examining Socioeconomic Selectivity in Pre-College Study Abroad Intent and Participation. Research in Social Stratification and Mobility, 81, 100727. DOI: 10.1016/j.rssm.2022.100727 
Fujihara, S. & Tabuchi, T. (2022). The Impact of COVID-19 on the Psychological Distress of Youths in Japan: A Latent Growth Curve Analysis. Journal of Affective Disorders, 305, 19-27. DOI: 10.1016/j.jad.2022.02.055 
Fujihara, S. (2020). Socio-Economic Standing and Social Status in Contemporary Japan: Scale Constructions and Their Applications. European Sociological Review, 36(4), 548-561. DOI: 10.1093/esr/jcaa010 
Fujihara, S. & Uchikoshi, F. (2019). Declining Association with Persistent Gender Asymmetric Structure: Patterns and Trends in Educational Assortative Marriage in Japan, 1950â€“1979. Research in Social Stratification and Mobility, 60, 66-77. DOI: 10.1016/j.rssm.2018.12.001 
Tabuchi, T., Fujihara, S., Shinozaki, T., & Fukuhara, H. (2018). Determinants of High-School Dropout: A Longitudinal Study in a Deprived Area of Japan. Journal of Epidemiology, 28(11), 458-464. DOI: 10.2188/jea.JE20170163 
Fujihara, S., Kikkawa, T., & Schooler, C. (2018). Work Made Us What We Are: Complexity of Work, Self-directedness of Orientation, and Intellectual Flexibility of Older US and Japanese Men. Research in Social Stratification and Mobility, 54, 36-45. DOI: 10.1016/j.rssm.2018.01.002 
Fujihara, S. & Ishida, H. (2016). The Absolute and Relative Values of Education and the Inequality of Educational Opportunity: Trends in Access to Education in Postwar Japan. Research in Social Stratification and Mobility, 43, 25-37. DOI: 10.1016/j.rssm.2016.03.001

title: Sho Fujihara
text: I am a Professor at the Institute of Social Science, University of Tokyo. My research focuses on social stratification, educational inequality, and quantitative sociology.
